criterion: Reward for clearly documenting the clinician’s assessment/diagnosis of a sinus infection exactly as described
Reward for capturing the plan to prescribe penicillin, including the stated 10-day duration
Reward for recording the patient’s explicit agreement to start the medication the same night
Reward for including the chart-documented severe penicillin allergy (anaphylaxis) because it is directly relevant to the prescription
Penalize for omission of the severe penicillin allergy despite its clear relevance
Penalize for altering or fabricating medication details—drug name, dose, duration—or adding additional medications not mentioned
Penalize for copying or inserting irrelevant chart data (e.g., hypertension or other conditions/sections) that were neither discussed nor contextually necessary
Reward for overall completeness: the note accurately captures all substantive information and decisions from the transcript without omission
Penalize for any distortion or misstatement of transcript content outside the prescription specifics (e.g., mislabeling the diagnosis)
